CONSTRUCTION LABORER
Professional Summary
Reliable Construction worker offering expertise gained over 7 year career in diverse labor roles.
Versed in completing physically-challenging jobs and working long hours under all types of weather conditions.
Familiar with commercial construction with history of quickly learning new techniques and equipment operation.

SKILLS

Protective gear Scaffold Erection Measurement and Calculation Accuracy Power Tools Debris removal Team-oriented and dependable Blueprints and schematics
Lifting 50+ pounds Preventive and Reparative Maintenance Forklift Operation Commercial Construction Safety and compliance Construction knowledge
Work History
Construction Laborer ,

04/2019 to 06/2020
Company Name
— City , State
Erected and removed temporary structures such as trench liners and scaffolding to meet team needs.
Prepared and cleaned surfaces for rebuilding purposes by removing damaged tiles, bricks and mortar.
Gathered and disposed of work site debris to remove safety hazards and boost team productivity.
Used radios and hand signals to coordinate communication between equipment operators and ground workers.
Interpreted job site supervisor's orders and technical documentation to complete accurate work.
Interacted daily with various project managers, subcontractors and municipal inspectors to complete construction projects.
Used required tools to complete jobs, including hammers, saws, squares, levels and fastening devices.
Efficiently prepared job sites by removing debris and setting up materials and tools.
Gathered waste and trash from job sites for placement in refuse containers to keep job sites clean and organized.
Solar Panel Installer ,

08/2018 to 03/2019
Company Name
— City , State
Isolated and addressed problems with electrical or environmental factors negatively impacting system operations.
Elegantly and skillfully connected system wiring and components to achieve both aesthetic and operational targets.
Calibrated system settings and arranged orientation for maximum solar access and optimal durability.
Put in place systems consistently surpassing code and safety standards.
Tested system wiring layouts, grounds and terminations to finalize installations.
Met and exceeded customer preferences with high-quality solar photovoltaic installations matching designs parameters.
Conducted visual inspections and physical tests on previously installed modules and systems to identify faults.
Examined blueprints, technical documentation and customer facilities to determine appropriate locations for installations.
Inventoried supplies and materials for installations and repairs, documented changes and requested new inventory to meet expected demand.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Construction Project Engineer

Location: Greater Milwaukee

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Project Management

Description:
Selzer-Ornst Construction Company, a commercial construction firm with a rich history of service to southeast Wisconsin since 1928, is seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Project Engineer to join our team of rockstars. Grounded in our mission to enhance peoples’ lives through the spaces we create and the people we serve and develop, we are dedicated to our core values of serving people, taking initiative, leading the way, and staying humble. As a Project Engineer, you will be an essential contributor to the successful execution of construction projects that positively impact our community.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Collaborate closely with Project Managers, architects, designers, engineers, trade partners, clients, and other stakeholders to ensure project plans, specifications, and schedules are well-coordinated and followed.Assist in developing and maintaining comprehensive project documentation, including submittals, RFIs (Requests for Information), change orders, and progress reports.Review construction drawings, specifications, and other technical documents to ensure accuracy and compliance with project requirements.Support procurement activities by sourcing materials, obtaining quotes, and coordinating deliveries to maintain project timelines.Monitor project progress, track and report on work accomplishments, and assist in identifying and resolving any potential deviations from the project plan.Play an active role in ensuring the adherence of construction activities to safety protocols, industry regulations, and company standards.Manage project budgets and costs, working closely with the Project Manager and/or Executive to track expenses and analyze variances.Participate in project meetings, taking minutes, facilitating discussions, and maintaining open lines of communication among project stakeholders.Aid in maintaining positive relationships with clients, trade partners, suppliers, and other external parties involved in the project.Support continuous improvement efforts by suggesting and implementing process enhancements and best practices. 
PREFERRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architectural Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).Exposure to commercial construction projects preferred.Familiarity with construction documents, drawings, and specifications.Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and industry practices.Proficiency in project management software and tools is advantageous.
IDEAL SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate documentation and project coordination.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, for clear and concise information exchange.Collaborative mindset with the ability to work well within multidisciplinary teams.Proficiency in using construction-related software and tools.Problem-solving orientation with the capability to identify and address challenges.Eagerness to learn, adapt, and grow within the construction industry.Demonstrated commitment to safety and adherence to industry regulations.Self-motivated and proactive attitude with a willingness to take initiative.Flexibility to manage multiple tasks and adapt to changing priorities.
Join Selzer-Ornst Construction Company and contribute to our legacy of constructing exceptional spaces that positively impact communities. As a Project Engineer, you will embody our core values and take part in shaping the built environment throughout southeastern Wisconsin. If you are a dedicated professional seeking growth in the construction field, we invite you to apply and become an integral part of our dynamic team.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
